gcmd-production.description: Primary production bucket for StayCurrentMD app

videos/.organization: Flat structure - all files in root of videos/ folder
videos/.file_association: Videos and thumbnails share same hash-based filename (different extensions)

vimeo_videos/.description: Larger file sizes than main videos folder, likely higher quality

conferences/.status: Folder structure exists but no content yet

Transcription/.note: May be used for storing transcription results in the future

videos/.note: 3,434 are duplicates of production videos, 47 are unique

video_files.purpose: Content-addressable storage - same content = same hash

thumbnail_files.pattern: Same hash as video + image extension
thumbnail_files.association: Thumbnails share filename with their corresponding video

special_files.note: These appear to be special content or branding assets

storage_patterns.separation: Videos and thumbnails stored together in same folder
storage_patterns.scalability: Hash-based naming allows for efficient deduplication
storage_patterns.metadata: No separate metadata files found - likely stored in database

likely_usage: Videos served via CloudFront or direct S3 URLs
Hash-based filenames used as unique identifiers
Database likely maps hash to video metadata (title, description, etc.)

data_flow.upload: Videos uploaded → Hashed → Stored in S3 with hash as filename
data_flow.thumbnail: Thumbnails generated → Stored with same hash + image extension
data_flow.access: App queries database → Gets hash → Constructs S3 URL → Serves content

insights.content_volume: Large medical video library (~7k unique videos)
insights.organization: Simple flat structure - easy to manage but may need organization as it grows
insights.transcription_status: Transcription folder exists but empty - transcription work in progress
insights.vimeo_migration: Large batch of videos imported from Vimeo in July 2023
insights.testing_environment: Testing bucket contains mostly duplicates - good for safe testing

organization: Consider subfolders by date or category if structure grows
Transcription folder ready for future use
Conferences folder structure in place for future content
optimization: Consider lifecycle policies for old/unused content
Implement versioning if needed for content updates
CloudFront CDN likely in use for video delivery
